page.title: 01Norham- An introduction.
page.content: NORHAM-ON-TWEED The village is built on the site of an ancient settlement, nestling beside a ford over the River Tweed, protected by its formidable castle, (painted by Turner, and immortalised by Sir Walter Scott in "Marmion.") where lived the Warden of the Eastern Marches, it withstood many fierce attacks by the Scots. Now a quiet village and conservation area, it tries to preserve its identity, whilst doing its best to provide the amenities which its twentieth century inhabitants expect.
